text: Blue Winter () is a Canadian docufiction film, directed by André Blanchard and released in 1979.Gilles Marsolais, "Les Mots de la tribu". Cinémas : Revue d'études cinématographiques Vol. 4, Iss. 2 (Winter 1994): 133-150,188. Using a cast of non-professional actors, the film centres on Christiane (Christiane Lévesque) and Nicole (Nicole Scant), two young adult sisters trying to establish themselves in the economically struggling city of Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec."Hiver bleu, L’ – Film d’André Blanchard". Films du Québec, January 30, 2009.
